reviews.review:
Graphics: Despite the oldness of the game, the visuals themselves are enough to look nice. The physics, although a big deal at the time, feel jumpy at times, especially with the vehicles and collisions.

Gameplay: I'm not sure if it was just me, but the first quarter of the game felt very high strung (you're on the run), and it was hard to feel like I had calm moments in the game. Halfway through the game, I felt like the pacing calmed and I could play at a slower pace. Apart from that, the story is great. The campaign felt right in terms of length, and there were many satisfying moments despite the frustrations early on. In terms of level design, I did find myself trying to figure out to go regularly. There are upsides in the sense that the game encourages exploring, but sometimes it was frustrating.
The gun play is some of the most intense I've seen, and that's on normal difficulty. As I said before, this game can be high stress. But I also see the good in that - despite the relative simpleness of the gun play, the guns feel balanced in usage. The difficulty also felt balanced - despite the tough moments, there is usually plenty of health to go around. I do wish ammo wasn't as hard to find in some places, especially ammo essential to kill/destroy important pieces.
The game does do a lot of vehicle sections of gameplay. I didn't mind them as much since they (occasionally) slowed down the pace. Again, the physics weren't smooth which led to frustration.

Sound: the guns, enemies, and general ambience are great, especially the infected enemies.

Overall: if you're into intense gun play, great technology for the time, and satisfying campaign, you can look past the technical and level design issues. I found myself enjoying the ending despite the rough beginning.

I missed this entire period of gaming and I have to say I am happy that I finally played it. I understand why this is typically listed as one of the greatest games ever. Also, I can run it on a non-gaming laptop at high settings and it is very smooth. The action is great and the puzzles aren't too demanding. The music kicks in at certain parts and the effect really works - you get pumped up! I can't wait to try everything else the source engine has to offer,
